title: The Blessed Ministry of Saint Couch Potato.
description:
A response inspired by video available here:

https://youtu.be/B8TMIjjz2uQ

From @thefridaymorningnameless7623

transcript_parts.text: I thought that making a video from this
hammock could be appropriate
for the topic that I wanted to talk
about
I was watching Chad's video and I really
enjoyed it and something that I've
felt before and have expressed before is
that the Alcoholics Anonymous program
really represents
the pattern of Salvation that was
discovered rediscovered I think in the
Reformation because I do believe it's
what the earliest Christians knew and
understand and understood
and the
terrible destructiveness of alcoholism
obviously leads people to
seek help
and the true alcoholic discovers that
they cannot do it on their own and it
requires a surrender and the guy that he
had the little clip the ego bus ego
reducer was talking about this need to
hit bottom and that he wanted to help
people hit bottom and that that was a
necessary first step
and so
um you know one of the criticisms that I
think people make about
Protestant Reform theology is that um
well God does everything so you can just
do whatever you want
and and you know I think even I have
been critical of the type of the type of
person there's a sort of meme about some
guy that
understands it and in our Corner we'll
say he just understands it
propositionally it doesn't really but
he's not participating that's what we'll
say and we'll say he just understands
the proper propositionally he's not
really participating because he doesn't
do anything
but
you know I think that there is something
to the fact that not doing anything is
actually a significant thing to do and
so even though I have said I have often
said like I wish those people would just
get out and do something go like you
know like because the love of God in
your life should produce works of
righteousness
but if you really believe that it's
nothing that we can do and it's only
what God can do which is truly what I
believe and our good works are a
response out of that
miraculous realization
then
for some people their life can actually
be an example of doing nothing
and what what purpose that serves is
that it will help the self-righteous
people hit bottom and you know I don't
want to say like oh self-righteous like
any you know everybody that criticizes
is self-righteous but honestly
self-righteousness is a big problem it
was definitely one of the things that
Jesus spoke out against a lot and to not
criticize any other Traditions or
religions I'll just use the example of
the woke the woke religion which is a
very self-righteous
um a very self-righteous religion
and the problem with all these
self-righteous things is that they they
you know they create a category of
good people and bad people and there's
not really a mechanism for a bad person
to become a good person and the good
people will say why don't you be good
but they are all of the type of person
to whom being good comes easily or
natural or or um you know
or at least society and their
willfulness doesn't acknowledge the ways
in which they are not actually good
people
um and so this guy who just sits there
confident in his Assurance of salvation
which you know perhaps there are some
people which is not really the case but
I do believe there are people there are
people who will consciously not do
anything
and in a sense to prove the fact that
they don't have to do anything
and boy what a stumbling block that is
to like a self-righteous person
that you know you're going to want to
say that guy doesn't get in that guy
doesn't have it because he's not doing
anything whereas I'm doing all this
stuff obviously he's a bad he's not a
good person I'm a good person
and so I'm I call this guy now I'm going
to call him Saint couch potato
and I think that he has a very important
role
to play
um
because
you know if if the your comparison to
someone else who you look at and say
look at that lazy Couch Potato they need
to get red pilled really need to you
know do something
and um that upsets you
you know I think you have to ask why why
does that upset you what part of you is
being upset and is it not your ego that
needs to be reduced that is upset by
that person
um
because that is you know the love
that a child has
the baby doesn't do anything to earn
love from a parent
it's just bestowed upon them
because of who they are in relation to
the person and I think that that's the
thing once we realize that we are a
child of God
um you know maybe every once in a while
God has a child that he wants to spoil
I don't know if they necessarily see it
that way but you know there there is
something to the fact if you truly you
you know somebody has to live out their
true beliefs and if your true belief is
and I think that this is the true belief
of people who do a tremendous amount of
good things
which is sort of antithetical to the
facts but if God requires nothing of you
other than to put your trust in him
he might ask you to not do anything and
I'm not saying he won't ask you to do
anything I'm saying he may ask you to
not do anything
and so
Saint couch potato
may be a very blessed and obedient Saint
in that regard
that's my thought
